original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'di byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i tshul gnas kyi rnam pa bcu bdun bo la sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir bsten par mdzad pa 'am /

original: de bas na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa de ni gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa de ni gnas su 'gyur ro //

original: yang na thams cad la mchog tu 'gyur ba'i dngos grub zag pa med pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i ngo bo nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' ni rab tu dga' ba ste /

original: de nyid ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: That itself is the purity of the Joyous.

original: de nyid ni gnas yin pas na rab tu dga' pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni gnas yin pas na rab tu dga' pa rnam par dag pa'i gnas so //
translated: That itself is the abode, thus it is the abode of the purity of the Joyous.

original: 'di gang gi gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang gi gnas yin zhe na /
translated: Whose abode is this?

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
translated: The Blessed One Vajrasattva is the abode of the bodhisattva.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This teaches the following:

original: gang 'di rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i gnas te /
analyzed: gang 'di rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i gnas te /
translated: That which is the abode of the purity of the Joyous is the abode of the Blessed One Vajrasattva, the bodhisattva.

original: sems can gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gdul bar bya ba'i phyir rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the basis for the training of sentient beings.

original: de yang gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di des 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams rnams la 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags rab tu spong bar mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'di des 'dul ba'i sems can gyi khams rnams la 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags rab tu spong bar mdzad pa'am /
translated: Moreover, because this pure stage of the Joyful One is the realm of sentient beings to be disciplined by him, he is the one who causes the abandonment of passion through passion.

original: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @18a * //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sgo'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @18a * //
translated: Or, for the bodhisattvas who practice the conduct of the mantra approach,

original: rnams kyi gnas de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas te /
analyzed: rnams kyi gnas de ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas te /
translated: that stage is the stage of the Blessed Vajrasattva.

original: sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir rten du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir rten du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the basis for the sake of disciplining sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas des rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la brten te bsgom pa'i stobs kyis gnas de nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas des rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa la brten te bsgom pa'i stobs kyis gnas de nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because that pure stage of the Joyful One is the basis for the pure Joyful One, by the power of meditation one will attain that stage.

original: de bas na rab tu dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin pas som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu dga' ba ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' yin pas som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Joyful One is the Blessed Vajrasattva. Do not doubt this.

original: de yang de nyid las /
analyzed: de yang de nyid las /
translated: And that same text says:

original: kun gyi dam pa dngos grub mchog / dbang phyug chen po thog ma'i lha //
analyzed: kun gyi dam pa dngos grub mchog / dbang phyug chen po thog ma'i lha //
translated: The supreme of all, the supreme power, the great lord, the primordial deity,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa rgyal po che //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa rgyal po che //
translated: The great king of vajra holders,

original: rab tu dga' ba mi 'gyur mchog /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba mi 'gyur mchog /
translated: the supreme one of the immovable, is delighted.

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: shin tu dga' bas na rab tu dga' ba'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: shin tu dga' bas na rab tu dga' ba'o zhes bshad de /
translated: Because of being extremely delighted, it is the Joyful One.

original: gsang ba lngas sems can rnams smin pa la spyod par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: gsang ba lngas sems can rnams smin pa la spyod par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning is that he acts to ripen sentient beings through the five secrets.

original: de ltar na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid 'di bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar na rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid 'di bshad pa yin no ;
translated: Thus, by this abode of the purity of the Joyful One, this essence of Vajrasattva is explained.

original: / bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dus kyi rjes thogs la phan tshun kun du chags pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / bud med dang skyes pa'i dbang po gnyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba'i dus kyi rjes thogs la phan tshun kun du chags pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the bliss and mental bliss of the union of the two organs of the female and male arise in mutual passion,

original: 'dod chags kyi mda' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mda' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the arrow of passion, etc., is stated.

original: 'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: Passion is characterized by attachment.

original: 'dod chags nyid mda' yin pas na 'dod chags kyi mda' ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid mda' yin pas na 'dod chags kyi mda' ste /
translated: Passion itself is an arrow, thus it is the arrow of passion.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba phra mo 'bigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba phra mo 'bigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pierces the subtle mind and mental activities.

original: 'dod chags kyi mda'i rnam par dag pa zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mda'i rnam par dag pa zhes sbyar te /
translated: The arrow of passion is applied.

original: phan tshun kun du chags pa las 'khyud pa dang / reg par byed la reg par gyur pa las ni phan tshun gcig la gcig yongs su mi 'dor ba'i chags pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun kun du chags pa las 'khyud pa dang / reg par byed la reg par gyur pa las ni phan tshun gcig la gcig yongs su mi 'dor ba'i chags pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From mutual attachment, there is embracing and touching. From touching, there is the arising of attachment that does not abandon the other.

original: chags par gyur pa las ni phan tshun nye par sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chags par gyur pa las ni phan tshun nye par sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: From attachment, there is the desire to unite with the other.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa'i longs spyod thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi bdag po ni 'dod chags kyi mdas rnam par bcom pa ni bdag tu 'dzin ba'i rnam pa'i shes rab ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa'i longs spyod thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi bdag po ni 'dod chags kyi mdas rnam par bcom pa ni bdag tu 'dzin ba'i rnam pa'i shes rab ni lta ba'o //
translated: The lord of all enjoyments, such as kingship, is destroyed by the arrow of passion. The wisdom that is the aspect of grasping a self is view.

original: phan tshun reg pa las kun du byung ba'i mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun reg pa las kun du byung ba'i mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The delight that arises from mutual contact is joy.

original: chags pas zil gyis non pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa na 'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: chags pas zil gyis non pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa na 'ang 'bral bar mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: The desire not to be separated from the other in the future by those overcome by attachment is craving.

original: dbang phyug gi gnas kyis myos pa rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi ngo bo @18b nyid ni snyems pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gi gnas kyis myos pa rnams kyi nga rgyal gyi ngo bo @18b nyid ni snyems pa'o //
translated: Pride is the essence of the haughtiness of those intoxicated with the status of a lord.

original: bdag tu lta ba la zhugs pa rnams kyi me tog la sogs pas bdag nyid brgyan pa ni rgyan no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la zhugs pa rnams kyi me tog la sogs pas bdag nyid brgyan pa ni rgyan no //
translated: Adornment is the adorning of oneself with flowers, etc. by those who are engaged in the view of self.

original: mgu ba dang dga' ba'i 'debs yid tshim pa'o //
analyzed: mgu ba dang dga' ba'i 'debs yid tshim pa'o //
translated: Delight is the satisfaction of the mind through joy.

original: mngon par sbyor bar 'dod pa'i mar me la sogs pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par sbyor bar 'dod pa'i mar me la sogs pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: Illumination is the lamp, etc. for one who wishes to apply oneself.

original: nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pa rnams mtho ba las nyams pa ni 'jigs pas khrus la sogs pas lus kyi dri ma bsal ba ni lus kyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis zil gyis non pa rnams mtho ba las nyams pa ni 'jigs pas khrus la sogs pas lus kyi dri ma bsal ba ni lus kyi bde ba'o //
translated: Physical well-being is the removal of the impurities of the body through bathing, etc. out of fear of falling from a high place for those overcome by pride.

original: bdag nyid kyi rgyan gyi rgyur gyur ba rab tu dang ba la sogs pa ni gzugs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rgyan gyi rgyur gyur ba rab tu dang ba la sogs pa ni gzugs so //
translated: Form is the clarity, etc. which is the cause of one's own adornment.

original: yid tshim pa thob pa rnams kyis gcig la gcig smra ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: yid tshim pa thob pa rnams kyis gcig la gcig smra ba ni sgra'o //
translated: Sound is the conversation of those who have attained satisfaction.

original: snang ba yod pas na gcig gis gcig mthong bas dris nyug pa ni dri'o //
analyzed: snang ba yod pas na gcig gis gcig mthong bas dris nyug pa ni dri'o //
translated: Smell is the mutual investigation through seeing one another because of the existence of illumination.

original: lus kyi dri ma dang bral nas phan tshun zas snyod pa ni ro'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dri ma dang bral nas phan tshun zas snyod pa ni ro'o //
translated: Having become free from the body's impurities, they enjoy each other's company, which is taste.

original: de nas de'i rjes su myong ba ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i rjes su myong ba ste /
translated: Then comes the experience of that.

original: 'di ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rim pa yin no //
translated: This is the process of entering cyclic existence.

original: gang gi tshe rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa nyid 'dod chags kyi mda' zhes bshad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdo rje yid las byung ba la sogs pa nyid 'dod chags kyi mda' zhes bshad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the vajra born of mind and so forth are explained to be the arrow of passion,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i bde ba myong ba rnams sam bde ba ma myong ba rnams de thob par 'dod pas yang dang yang du rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid la kun du zhen par sgom pa ni 'dod chags te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i bde ba myong ba rnams sam bde ba ma myong ba rnams de thob par 'dod pas yang dang yang du rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid la kun du zhen par sgom pa ni 'dod chags te /
translated: then those who experience the bliss of Vajrasattva or those who do not experience that bliss, desiring to attain that, repeatedly meditate on the imagination of the nature of Vajrasattva. This is passion.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
analyzed: 'dod chags dam tshig yin par bshad //
translated: Passion is explained to be the pledge.

original: chos kyi 'dod pa yid du 'ong //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'dod pa yid du 'ong // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The desirable Dharma is pleasing.

original: 'di bsgoms pas kyang rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bsgoms pas kyang rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni reg pa'o //
translated: Meditating on this, one actualizes the nature of Vajrasattva, which is contact.

original: reg pa las ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par skyes pa las kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa las ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag par skyes pa las kye ma'o sems can 'di dag ni ngo bo nyid kyis sdug bsngal pa ste /
translated: From contact, the great compassion of the bodhisattva arises, which has the nature of the thought: ‚ÄúAlas! These sentient beings are by nature miserable,

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i khams gsum pa rnams ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i khams gsum pa rnams ni /
translated: and, due to their attachment to the apprehension of self and entities connected to the self, they circle in the three realms like a waterwheel.üîΩThey do not see that all phenomena are the nature of nonentity. I will teach them the path.‚Äù

original: zo chun gyi rgyud mo ltar 'khor ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma mthong ba yin gyi gang bdag gis 'di rnams la lam yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems canüîΩrnams la chags pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zo chun gyi rgyud mo ltar 'khor ba ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ma mthong ba yin gyi gang bdag gis 'di rnams la lam yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po'i mtshan nyid can gyis sems can rnams la chags pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: This great compassion is the bodhisattva‚Äôs attachment to sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes nyid dang mi bral bar 'dod pa ni chags pa ste sdug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa'i ye shes nyid dang mi bral bar 'dod pa ni chags pa ste sdug pa'o //
translated: It is attachment, or love, in the sense of not being separate from the wisdom that realizes the nature of reality.

original: snying rje chen po gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen po gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva, who is controlled by great compassion, wishes to benefit all sentient beings.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pas thams @19a * //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i sprul pas thams @19a * //
translated: The emanations of Vajra Humkara and so forth are the emanations of the emanation body.üîΩ

original: cad la dbang phyug dang / dbang rnam par dag pa ni dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: cad la dbang phyug dang / dbang rnam par dag pa ni dbang phyug ste /
translated: The power of the lord and the purity of power are the lordliness of Vajra Humkara and so on.

original: dpang phyug ni longs spyod ma lus pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpang phyug ni longs spyod ma lus pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Power is the perfection of all enjoyments.

original: dbang ni de la dbang du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbang ni de la dbang du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Lordliness is the mastery of that.

original: bsgom pa la kun du zhen pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa la kun du zhen pa rnams kyi yang dag pa'i don rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab ni lta ba'o //
translated: The view is the wisdom that analyzes the ultimate for those who are attached to meditation.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
translated: The joy is the delight that comes from making the nature of Vajrasattva manifest.

original: sdug par sems pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: sdug par sems pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: The craving is the desire for the complete nirvana of all that is thought of as dear.

original: thams cad la dbang phyug dang rnam par dag pa la gnas pa rnams sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid las gnyis su med pa nyid du yang dag par ston pa'i dregs pa ni snyems pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad la dbang phyug dang rnam par dag pa la gnas pa rnams sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid las gnyis su med pa nyid du yang dag par ston pa'i dregs pa ni snyems pa ste /
translated: The pride is the arrogance of those who abide in power and purity, who demonstrate their own nonduality in order to act for the sake of sentient beings.

original: spro ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: spro ba'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: It is the ornament of the seven factors of enlightenment, which is the characteristic of delight.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang bral ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyan ni rgyan no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang bral ba rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi mtshan nyid can gyi rgyan ni rgyan no //
translated: The ornament of the seven factors of enlightenment, which is the characteristic of those who are free from the view of self, is the ornament.

original: de nas kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab ni yid tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nas kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab ni yid tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: Then, the wisdom which is the characteristic of the uninterrupted path is the satisfaction of the mind.

original: de nas kyang spyan lnga'i rang bzhin can ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: de nas kyang spyan lnga'i rang bzhin can ni snang ba'o //
translated: Then, the nature of the five eyes is the light.

original: de nas bdag med par mthong ba ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: de nas bdag med par mthong ba ni lta ba'o //

original: de'i rgyu la rab tu mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu la rab tu mgu ba ni dga' ba'o //

analyzed: mngon par 'dod par gyur pa de la spro ba'i grags pa ni snyems pa'o //

original: des kyang rab kyi mthar @20a * //
analyzed: des kyang rab kyi mthar @20a * //

original: thug par gyur pa dang / de la spyan lnga ste /
analyzed: thug par gyur pa dang / de la spyan lnga ste /

analyzed: sha'i spyan dang / lha'i spyan dang / shes rab kyi spyan dang / chos kyi spyan dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan te /

translated: Then, the contact is the direct realization of the nature of each of the five aggregates, free from the stains of morality, etc., which is the Dharma body, etc.

analyzed: rab tu dga' ba rnam par dag pa'i gnas mngon sum du byas pa dang / de yongs su mi spong ba'i chags pa ni sdug pa'o //
translated: The beauty is the attachment to the non-abandonment of the direct realization of the pure state of joy.

original: des na nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i rmongs pas skabs mi phyed par rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam par thar pa thob pas lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ni thams cad la dbang phyug dang / dbang rnam par dag pa thob pa ste /

translated: Therefore, by attaining the liberation that is naturally radiant, without being obstructed by either afflicted or unafflicted delusion, one enters spontaneously, with mastery over everything, and attains pure mastery.

analyzed: bde ba chen po rab tu dga' ba'i bde bas brgyad pa'i dbang phyug tu gyur pa ste /

original: 'di ni de'i sgo'i rim pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i sgo'i rim pa yin no //

original: yul spangs pa'i thar pas skrag pa rnams la ni tshul 'di yin te /
analyzed: yul spangs pa'i thar pas skrag pa rnams la ni tshul 'di yin te /

analyzed: de rnams kyis 'khor ba'i gzugs mi brtan pa spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the unstable forms of cyclic existence,

analyzed: lta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs thob ste /

original: bde ba chen po myong bar 'gyur ro zhes nges par dgod par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs yang dag par ston par mdzad pa ni gzugs so //

translated: In order to definitely establish that they will experience great bliss, the BhagavƒÅn teaches form, which is the form that he explained.

analyzed: de bas na pi wang brdungs pa la brtson pa ni sgra'o //

analyzed: de med par yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyag na dri bsnams pa ni dri'o //

analyzed: bza' ba med par shin tu dga' bar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: bdug spos med par yid tshim par mi 'gyur te de bas na spos so //
